title: Baron, the great epic monster that grants game changing buffs to your team and a huge amount of gold
body:
...can be cheese killed as soon as it spawns in under 20 seconds by any tank and DPS champ duoing it 

Great!

replies.body:
It doesn't seem like a whole lot has changed recently that would cause this to be a new thing, but it definitely seems to be something being talked about nowadays. Is this just an optimization players are making more regularly now? Has something changed materially to make this particular tactic more effective? Or is it just the flavor of the month topic on the list of things that suck that about the game?

Edit: Thanks for all the responses.

I don't know what the exact reason is for it but if I had to guess it's the general powercreep of the game that happened over the last few years. Everyone deals so fucking high amounts of damage that you can just shred through baron, especially with mountain drake. Remember when a 20 minute baron was something special that only happened when you somehow managed to ace the enemy team and even then it was risky because it took pretty long to take? Now it's completly normal that one team rushes it down at the 20 minute mark, often times so fast that you can't even get there in time even if you start walking there the moment they start it. But maybe I'm just nostalgic.

Its like high damage does everything that we don't like.

Baron is a joke. 
Games are snow bally because high damage on very small leads. 
Jungle clears too fast so junglers gank time is too high. 
Dragons are easy to take because of high damage. 
Burst damage isn't fun to play against (zoe anyone)

Hmmm, maybe its time to lower damage.

The beginning of this competitive season was all about how long game time was. Perhaps the road forward involves decreasing overall damage while swinging the pendulum more in favor of solo carrying can try to keep game time the same while putting the onis on players with leads to close out?

The competitive games are so long because of how damage there is and how snowbally the current game is. 

Pro’s livelihoods are based on winning. 
With how risky any legit play is currently and how if the play fails there’s a good chance it will lose them the game, they literally can’t afford to make mistakes. 
So they play it as safe as they physical can and that makes long and boring games.

That power creep was boosted a lot by new masteries/runes, because they give lots of impactful stats and changes to the game.

I believe that focusing on nerfing the strong instead of buffing the weak will slowly begin to solve the power creep issue, instead of just doing something like "everyone deals 10% less damage now"

For the power creep to be caused by runes / masteries means that you do more damage to baron with new runes / masteries then it was with old runes / materies.

Is this really true?

Aside from the flat amount of stats you get from choosing which primary / secondary rune tree you go, the things in new masteries that can increase the amount of damage you do to baron is like gathering storm / the legend things in precision / the bone tooth thing in domination / chrysalis.

At 20 minutes I guess an ADC benefits a little Legend / gathering storm starting to stack.

But for the old masteries you had double edged sword originally giving you a flat 5% dmg increase to baron (which was lowered later admittedly), but I'm not entirely convinced that the new masteries have more damage to baron then the old ones.

If the masteries are the true culprit on average you should be doing more damage to baron at 20 minutes, which I think is measured best by using data from the past (does anyone actually have this?) and now.

I will agree everyone should feel as if they're taking more damage now then before, but that's because we don't have armor seals / mr glpyhs that were in the past (but they were implemented by changing everyones base stats I think?), and you get more AP for example now from running Sorc + inspiration then from running 3 AP quints.

Something else might be responsible for this but I dont know what that maybe, I can really only think of ways to confirm whether your claim is correct or not.

thunderlord is a prime example of free damage being introduced in the game for example.
It's like having a an extra spell to throw out and deal damage with.
Yes but his point is that this “free damage” is not affecting Baron. It only affects PVP aspects primarily.

I think that the masteries and runes give big power creep when it comes to fighting other players 1v1. this can lead to faster snowballing because runes make everyone scale harder and eventually easier barons because teams are more ahead. 

 but i think you're correct, runes do not conribute much towards taking baron.

> [{quoted}](name=Auz the Ripper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Hw55BOpn,comment-id=000c000200020000,timestamp=2018-03-28T15:48:49.024+0000)

> Before this Baron could and would _murder_ most teams that went after him early.

Very slight nerfs, compared to how whole teams take it or a tank + DPS champion. The problem is that Baron doesn't do enough AoE damage since it attacks the closest champion who usually tanks it while the rest DPS him down with little damage taken. So it's not dangerous for more than one champion (that aren't squishy) to take it since they can take the punishment for long enough.

If Baron was at least more AoE oriented as Vilemaw is on TT, then maybe just DPSing it down without much effort and HP wouldn't be an issue.

I think the issue is that Baron could already be killed very fast for some time now, but now that Baron buff is even more impactful, it feels like far too strong a win condition for how easily it can be taken down. People previously just complained about Baron being a weak monster (and you should be able to check this, as there have been many threads made about this pre-buff buff), but now people are complaining about Baron being a weak monster _that also gives too strong a buff_, and it is this combination that is new. Do you think Baron and its buff are in a good state right now?

I think both Dragon and Baron (excluding the thoughts on what they actually do buff wise), need to be revamped, either their stats, or mechanics.

Dragon should NOT be solo-able until someone is lvl 11+. At least in my opinion. Baron should NOT be duo-able until end game, or have Baron scale with the timer, making it a MUST to have a team do it. 

We can argue back and forth that it should be soloable, cause "you can collapse on a guy soloing it, or  just your jungler has to keep an eye on it", vs "it needs to be strong enough where a group of players need to take it out, to force more team play cooperatively".

I totally agree with you but the problem lies within game pacing.  If what you want was implemented the objectives would essentially become meaningless.  This is because by the time they were contested (if at all) with your suggested changes but under current game pacing standards the game would have already been decided or maybe one dragon fight would be decisive.  The buffs themselves wouldn't be useful because the team that acquired them really didn't need it to steamroll the team who's already lost.

TL:DR

I think monster objectives have gotten weaker due to game pacing picking up.  If monster objectives became stronger game pacing would have to be changed or they wouldn't have any impact on the outcome of a game 90% of the time.
